title.narrative: Incidencia politica desde las organizaciones economicas campesinas - OECAS

description.narrative:
In 2004 CIOEC submitted an initiative Law for the legal recognition of the Rural Economic Organisations (OECAs). After years of stagnation, CIOEC re-introduced the initiative and sought for approval in 2012. Early 2013 the law was approved by the government and CIOEC was asked to work out a regulation of the law. Once peasants are legally represented by CIOEC, it will become possible for the OECAs to access funds foreseen for the agricultural development of the country. This process has not been completely finalised in 2013. The projects focuses on a) the further legal reglementation and implementation of the law and b) the integration of peasant’s representatives in national political discussion platforms or advisory boards so that the OECAs can get access to funding for their economic development. For this the Farmers' Advocacy Consultation Tool (FACT) will be used within CIOEC.
Specific objectives
(a) Reinforce the OECAs by the formulation of strategic actions, within the framework of the OECA law (i.e. regulations); (b) Consolidate the inclusion of the OECAs in the public-private agenda setting at the local, subnational and national level within the OECA law (i.e. implementation of the OECA law). (c) Promote the participation of the OECAs leaders in order to increase the farmers' voices in the public and private sector.
Expected results
• Instruments in order to start the implementation of the OECA law have been designed and put into practice. • CIOEC and the departments of CIOEC have elaborated their lobby plans in favour of the OECAs. • CIOEC - at national and subnational level - and the OECAs have consolidated their participation into the different economic development platforms in the county (at the national, departamental and local level) • Leaders of CIOEC and OECAs have increased their lobby and advocacy skills (especailly young farmers and women) • Strategic alliances have been built.
Summary of the activities
• Elaboration of the instruments in order to be able to implement the OECA law • Organisation of workshops to elaborate the lobby agenda for the OECAs at the different levels (national, departmental and local) • Negotiations with local government • Training of leaders of local and departmental level in lobby and advocacy skills (Farmers' Advocacy Consultation Tool) • Networking with other organisations of the private and public sector.
Regulation and implementation of the OECA law
